title: Application of Web-Based Constructivist Learning Environments for Unstructured Problem-Solving and Psychomotor Skill Development in Vocational Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental language proficiency and mastery of vocational foundational skills
context.additional_context: Enhanced Unstructured Language Problem-Solving and Contextual Response Training in Smartphone-Centric Limited Technology Environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze unstructured language problems occurring in real-world job situations with over 80% accuracy and propose solutions.
Learners improve their psychomotor function (e.g., context-appropriate linguistic responses) by over 70% through interaction with peers using collaborative tools.
Learners can establish and implement self-directed problem-solving strategies using scaffolding and coaching systems provided in a web-based constructivist learning environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
